description: Consult department for detailed descriptions. Recent topics include: Globalization; Race & Criminal Justice; Democracy & Markets in Postcommunist Europe.
name: Culture and World Politics

values.comments:
Consult department for detailed descriptions. More than one course may be taken in a given semester. Typical topics that may be offered include: Political Ideologies of the Non-Western world, Gandhian Thought, and politics of Zionism.

Each student praised this course for its discussion-based focus and felt that they gained a lot from the class. One student called this course his “favorite class at Penn.” Another remarked that the course was “eye opening and thought provoking.”

Students were very positive in their commentary on Professor Doherty-Sil. Several students in particular said she was “excellent,” and another student praised her “constructive feedback on papers and assignments.”

Students noted that there is a lot of assigned reading, and active class participation is expected. The majority of these students were Pre-Law.
